page.title: 01Clay Cross and area
page.content: {Clay Cross}is well placed on the {A61 8km south of Chesterfield.}It is on a high ridge between the valleys of the {River Amber}and{Rother . The population of Clay Cross is about {10,000}and about the same number live in Tupton and Holmgate.{George {Stephenson }built the railway tunnel here in{1837.}He bought a lot of the land when he found coal and other minerals. He started{Clay Cross Works. Clay Cross is a mainly industrial area. There are{36 factories here. Most people used to be coal miners but there are more{industrial}workers now. Unemployment is high in Clay Cross. We have a medium sized shopping area{with 3 supermarkets and 2 banks. There is an open air{market every {Saturday.}Most of the residents have lived here for all their lives. It is a place with{great community spirit.
